member.name: T:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.GenericListAdaptor`1
member.summary: Reorderable list adaptor for generic list.

remarks.para: This adaptor can be subclassed to add special logic to item height calculation. You may want to implement a custom adaptor class where specialised functionality is needed.
List elements which implement the interface are cloned using that interface upon duplication; otherwise the item value or reference is simply copied.

member.name: T:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor
member.summary: Adaptor allowing reorderable list control to interface with list data.

member.name: M:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.CanDrag(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether an item can be reordered by dragging mouse.

remarks.para: This should be a light-weight method since it will be used to determine whether grab handle should be included for each item in a reorderable list.
Please note that returning a value of false does not prevent movement on list item since other draggable items can be moved around it.

member.returns: A value of true if item can be dragged; otherwise false.

member.name: M:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.CanRemove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether an item can be removed from list.

remarks.para: This should be a light-weight method since it will be used to determine whether remove button should be included for each item in list.
This is redundant when is specified.

member.returns: A value of true if item can be removed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.Add
member.summary: Add new element at end of list.

member.name: M:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.Insert(System.Int32)
member.summary: Insert new element at specified index.

member.name: M:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.Duplicate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Duplicate existing element.

remarks.para: Consider using the interface to duplicate list elements where appropriate.

member.name: M:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.Remove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove element at specified index.

member.name: M:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.Move(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Move element from source index to destination index.

member.name: M:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.Clear
member.summary: Clear all elements from list.

member.name: M:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.DrawItemBackground(UnityEngine.Rect,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws background of a list item.

remarks.para: This method is only used to handle GUI repaint events.
Background of list item spans a slightly larger area than the main interface that is drawn by since it is drawn behind the grab handle.

member.param: Total position of list element in GUI.

member.name: M:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.DrawItem(UnityEngine.Rect,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws main interface for a list item.

remarks.para: This method is used to handle all GUI events.

member.summary: Gets height of list item in pixels.

member.summary: Gets count of elements in list.

member.summary: Fixed height of each list item.

member.name: M:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListControl.HandleCommand(System.String,System.Int32,AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor)
member.summary: Invoked to handle context command.

remarks.para: It is important to set the value of GUI.changed to true if any changes are made by command handler.
Default command handling functionality can be inherited:

member.param: Name of command. This is the text shown in the context menu.
Zero-based index of item which was right-clicked.
member.returns: A value of true if command was known; otherwise false.

member.summary: Remove specified item.

member.name: M:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListControl.ClearAll(AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor)
member.summary: Remove all items from list.

remarks.para: The event is raised for each item prior to clearing array and allows entire operation to be cancelled.

member.returns: Returns a value of false if operation was cancelled.

member.summary: Occurs when add menu button is clicked.

member.summary: Occurs after list item is inserted or duplicated.

member.summary: Occurs before list item is removed and allowing for remove operation to be cancelled.

member.name: E:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListControl.ItemMoving
member.summary: Occurs immediately before list item is moved allowing for move operation to be cancelled.

member.name: E:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListControl.ItemMoved
member.summary: Occurs after list item has been moved.

member.name: T:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListControl.ItemDrawer`1
member.summary: Invoked to draw list item.

remarks.para: GUI controls must be positioned absolutely within the given rectangle since list items must be sized consistently.

example.para: The following listing presents a text field for each list item:

member.summary: Invoked to draw content for empty list with absolute positioning.

member.name: T:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags
member.summary: Additional flags which can be passed into reorderable list field.

example.para: Multiple flags can be specified if desired:
example.code: var flags = ReorderableListFlags.HideAddButton | ReorderableListFlags.HideRemoveButtons; ReorderableListGUI.ListField(list, flags);

member.name: F:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.DisableReordering
member.summary: Hide grab handles and disable reordering of list items.

member.name: F:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.HideAddButton
member.summary: Hide add button at base of control.

member.name: F:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.HideRemoveButtons
member.summary: Hide remove buttons from list items.

member.name: F:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.DisableContextMenu
member.summary: Do not display context menu upon right-clicking grab handle.

member.name: F:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.DisableDuplicateCommand
member.summary: Hide "Duplicate" option from context menu.

member.name: F:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.DisableAutoFocus
member.summary: Do not automatically focus first control of newly added items.

member.name: F:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.ShowIndices
member.summary: Show zero-based index of array elements.

member.name: F:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.DisableClipping
member.summary: Do not attempt to clip items which are out of view.

remarks.para: Clipping helps to boost performance, though may lead to issues on some interfaces.

member.name: M:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.ReorderableListGUI.TextFieldItemDrawer(UnityEngine.Rect,System.String)
member.summary: Draws text field allowing list items to be edited.

remarks.para: Null values are automatically changed to empty strings since null values cannot be edited using a text field.
Value of GUI.changed is set to true if value of item is modified.

member.param: Position to draw list item control(s).
member.returns: Modified value of list item.

member.name: T:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.SerializedPropertyAdaptor
member.summary: Reorderable list adaptor for serialized array property.

remarks.para: This adaptor can be subclassed to add special logic to item height calculation. You may want to implement a custom adaptor class where specialised functionality is needed.
List elements are not cloned using the interface when using a to manipulate lists.

member.name: F:AnimatorControllerEx.ReorderableList.SerializedPropertyAdaptor.FixedItemHeight
member.summary: Fixed height of each list item.

remarks.para: Non-zero value overrides property drawer height calculation which is more efficient.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
member.param: Non-zero height overrides property drawer height calculation.
